title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6058.5 - Division Reporting Requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6058.5 - Division Reporting Requirements

State Regulations
(a) On an annual basis, the commissioner
shall conspicuously publish on the division's website a comprehensive report
including the use of force information received under section
6058.3
of this Part during the
preceding year. (b) Such reports
shall not identify the names of the individuals involved, but for each use of
force event reported, shall list the following in accordance with section
837-t
of the
executive law: (1)
the type of use of
force; (2)
the date of the
event; (3)
the location of the
event disaggregated by county and law enforcement agencies involved; (4)
the town or city where the event
occurred; (5)
any additional
relevant location information; (6)
a description of the circumstances of the event; (7)
the race, sex, ethnicity, age (or, if
unknown, approximate age) of all persons engaging in the use of force; and
(8)
the race, sex, ethnicity, age (or, if unknown, approximate age) of all persons suffering an injury from
the use of force. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6058.5

Adopted

New

York State Register March 31, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 13, eff. 3/31/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
